event

Class EventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • event.EventManager

  • public class EventManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The manager that manages the scheduling of events with their rooms.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventManager()
      Initializes the event manager.

                                                   throws NoSuchConferenceException
        Return all events in an ArrayList of Strings.
        Parameters:
        conference - The name of the conference we are checking.
        Returns:
        all events. Index = event number.
        Throws:
        NoSuchConferenceException - when there is no conference with given name.

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • addRoom

        public void addRoom(int roomNumber,
                    int size)
             throws DuplicateRoomNumberException,
                    WrongRoomSizeException
        Add a valid room to the conference.
        Parameters:
        roomNumber - An int representing the room number
        size - An int representing the capacity of the room.
        Throws:
        DuplicateRoomNumberException - when room number exists.
        WrongRoomSizeException - when the room size is not applicable.

      • findEventStr

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • becomeSpeaker

        public void becomeSpeaker(java.lang.String attendee)
                   throws TooManySpeakerException
        Make attendee a speaker by updating all events related with them. Tips: 1. scan all events with attendee. 2. See if the number of speakers reach maximum. If it does, the user signs out from the event. 3. make attendee speaker of all the rest of events.
        Parameters:
        attendee - Attendee but string.
        Throws:
        TooManySpeakerException - when there are too many speakers in one or more of all the events that user signs up to.

      • switchVipEvent

        public void switchVipEvent(java.lang.String eventId,
                           boolean vip)
                    throws NoSuchEventException
        Switch an event between VIP and normal event.
        Parameters:
        eventId - The event we are setting.
        vip - if the event is VIP event.
        Throws:
        NoSuchEventException - when there is no event with the given eventId.

      • addUserToEvent

        public void addUserToEvent(java.lang.String type,
                           java.lang.String username,
                           int eventNumber)
                    throws NoSuchEventException,
                           InvalidUserException,
                           EventIsFullException,
                           TooManySpeakerException
        Add user to an event. MAKE SURE TO DOUBLE CHECK ALL CONDITIONS.
        Parameters:
        type - type of user
        username - username
        eventNumber - eventNumber.
        Throws:
        InvalidUserException - if input type is "Organizer".
        NoSuchEventException - if event corresponding to the input eventNumber does not exist.
        EventIsFullException - if event is full.
        TooManySpeakerException - if event already has maximum number of speakers.

      • setMaximumPeople

        public void setMaximumPeople(int roomNumber,
                             int newMaximum,
                             int eventNumber)
                      throws NoSuchEventException,
                             InvalidNewMaxNumberException,
                             javax.activity.InvalidActivityException
        set the maximum number of people in the selected event.
        Parameters:
        roomNumber - the room number of the event.
        newMaximum - the new maximum number of people.
        eventNumber - the event number of the selected event.
        Throws:
        NoSuchEventException - if event corresponding to the input eventNumber does not exist.
        InvalidNewMaxNumberException - if the new maximum number of the event is less than the existing attendees in that event
        javax.activity.InvalidActivityException - if there is no such room.

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(java.lang.String roomNo,
                     int numSpeakers,
                     int numAttendees,
                     java.sql.Timestamp time,
                     float meetingLength,
                     java.lang.String description,
                     java.lang.String vip,
                     java.lang.String conferenceName)
              throws NotInOfficeHourException,
                     TimeNotAvailableException,
                     javax.activity.InvalidActivityException,
                     RoomIsFullException,
                     NoSuchConferenceException
        Create and add a event.
        Parameters:
        roomNo: - room number.
        numSpeakers - the maximum number of speakers in the event.
        numAttendees - the maximum number of attendees of event.
        time: - time the meeting begins.
        meetingLength: - time length of the event.
        description: - description of event
        vip: - whether the event is for VIP only.
        conferenceName - The name of the conference.
        Throws:
        NotInOfficeHourException - if time out of working hour.
        TimeNotAvailableException - if time is not available.
        javax.activity.InvalidActivityException - if there's no such room.
        RoomIsFullException - if room is full.
        NoSuchConferenceException - if there is not a conference with given conference name.

      • cancelEvent

        public void cancelEvent(java.lang.String eventId,
                        java.lang.String conferenceName)
                 throws NoSuchEventException,
                        NoSuchConferenceException
        Cancel the certain Event.
        Parameters:
        eventId: - the id of the event in string.
        conferenceName - the name of the conference we are checking.
        Throws:
        NoSuchEventException - if cannot find event with given eventId.
        NoSuchConferenceException - if cannot find the conference with given name.

      • signOut

        public void signOut(java.lang.String eventId,
                    java.lang.String attendee)
             throws javax.activity.InvalidActivityException,
                    NoSuchEventException
        Make attendee sign out for an event.
        Parameters:
        eventId - Event id in String.
        attendee - Attendee with String.
        Throws:
        NoSuchEventException - when the event does not exist.
        javax.activity.InvalidActivityException - when Attendee does not have that event.
